title: Florida Governor's Race Is A Toss-Up
teaser: In Florida, a Republican and a Republican-turned-Democrat are waging one of the most negative campaigns in the country.
contentencoded:
In the Florida Governor’s race, Republican incumbent Rick Scott is battling it out with former Republican Governor Charlie Crist, who is now running as a Democrat, in what’s been described as one of the most negative ad campaigns in the country.

What does this say about Florida politics and where might the victor lead Florida in the next term?

WMFE‘s Matthew Peddie and the Miami Herald’s Sergio Bustos join Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson to discuss the race.

Guests

  • Matthew Peddie, news manager and host of WMFE’s “Intersection.” He tweets @matthew_peddie.
  • Sergio Bustos, politics editor for the Miami Herald. He tweets @heraldbustos.
